FAR EAST FORTUNE Juventus midfielder Hernanes could be latest star to move to Chinese Super League with Hebei China Fortune 
Brazilian international set to join Ezequiel Lavezzi and Gervinho at Manuel Pellegrini's side BY GARY STONEHOUSE Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JUVENTUS ace Hernanes could become the latest star to cash in with a move to China, although his agent claims no deal has yet been agreed. 
The Brazilian midfielder has struggled for match action this season and is believed to be a top target for Hebei China Fortuna. Getty Images 5 Juventus’ Hernanes could become the latest star to cash in with a move to China 
He has made just eight appearances in Serie A so far this campaign and it appears that a switch to the Far East is a major possibility.

Hernanes’ agent, Joseph Lee, told Corriere dello Sport: “I don’t know what point the two clubs are at, but at the moment I can say we don’t have any agreement with Hebei Fortune. 
“The important thing is for Hernanes to play, whether at Juve, in China or elsewhere. related articles Southampton want free agent Martin Caceres to help solve defensive crisis KURT ON THE CARPET After a run of poor results for Warbury, Kurt is summoned to see Nick Mid-week retreat Aitor Karanka is taking his struggling Boro side to Spain for some warm weather training this week TOM BARCLAY Bristol Rovers lead rant at unqualified agents who have football clubs over a barrel Argy bargy David Wagner and Garry Monk facing FA charge after late goal in Yorkshire derby sparks mass brawl at John Smith's Stadium 
“The fact he has been excluded from the Champions League list is certainly not a positive factor. 
“If Juventus were to reach an agreement with the Chinese club and if it’s a good situation for us, then Hernanes could move there.” 
Should the 31-year-old former Inter and Lazio ace make the move, he would be joining Ezequiel Lavezzi and Gervinho at Hebei. EMPICS Sport The Brazilian international is wanted by Hebei China Fortuna after losing his place in the Juve side Getty Images Former Man City boss Manuel Pellegrini is in charge at Hebei China Fortuna Getty Images Hernanes could join former PSG star Ezequiel Lavezzi at Hebei China Fortuna Getty Images Ex-Arsenal star Gervinho is also at Chinese Super League side Hebei China Fortuna 
The club is managed by former Manchester City boss Manuel Pellegrini. 
Hebei finished seventh in the Chinese Super League last season. 
Hernanes has been capped 27 times by Brazil, scoring twice for the Samba Boys. Watch all the Premier League action from Saturday in our Daily Round-Up
